work_status: With a job, but not at work because of temporary illness, vacation, strike
agent_profile_summary: Angela Mason, a 30-year-old mother of two living in Ann Arbor, Michigan, grew up in a modest household in the Midwest and made the conscious decision to enlist in the military at 18, choosing service over the more conventional path of community college and part-time work. This choice reshaped her life, offering discipline, purpose, and opportunities for education that she now uses to support her family and community. A committed volunteer at a local community center, she organizes programs for veterans and leads mindfulness workshops, reflecting her Buddhist practice and her belief in compassion and resilience. Balancing part-time work, parenting, and her pursuit of a master’s degree in social work, Angela navigates the tension between stability and growth, often relying on small, intentional habits like meditation and mindful breathing to stay grounded. Her life is defined by a deep sense of connection—whether with her family, her community, or those she helps—rooted in the values of kindness and service she developed through her experiences.
